common.model

Class AbstractMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.model.AbstractType
      • common.model.AbstractMove
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddToSixMove, RemoveMove, ShuffleMove, Swap2Move

    public abstract class AbstractMove
extends AbstractType
    Defines Move objects/classes. Moves can be created, performed and scored. They also must have a controller type capable of performing them.
    Author:
    Nicholas Panzarino
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Performs this move on some entity object(s).
      BoardSelectionController getController()
      Allows instances of objects to return a controller that can perform their move.

      Return the score change resulting from this move.

    • Method Detail

      • doMove

        public abstract boolean doMove()
        Performs this move on some entity object(s). Returns true if the move was made successfully, or false if the move was unsuccessful. If unsuccessful, no states should have been modified.
        Returns:

      • isSpecial

        public boolean isSpecial()
        Retruns whether or not this move is classified as a special move.
        Returns:

      • type

        public static java.lang.String type()
        Static Method that Determines the String value of this type of Square. This will be displayed in ComboBoxes. All subclasses should overwrite/hide this method.
        Returns:

      • getController

        public final BoardSelectionController getController()
        Allows instances of objects to return a controller that can perform their move.
        Returns:

        public static BoardSelectionController controller()
